classRec.name: SlotList
classRec.description: The SlotList class represents an immutable list of Slot objects.
classRec.author: Joa Ebert
Robert Penner

method.name: SlotList
method.description:
Creates and returns a new SlotList object.

A user never has to create a SlotList manually. Use the NIL element to represent an empty list. NIL.prepend(value) would create a list containing value

.
method.param: head The first slot in the list.
tail A list containing all slots except head.

method.name: append
method.description:
Appends a slot to this list.
Note: appending is O(n). Where possible, prepend which is O(1).
In some cases, many list items must be cloned to
avoid changing existing lists.
method.param: slot The item to be appended.
method.return: A list consisting of all elements of this list followed by slot.

method.name: filterNot
method.description:
Returns the slots in this list that do not contain the supplied listener.
Note: assumes the listener is not repeated within the list.
method.param: listener The function to remove.
method.return: A list consisting of all elements of this list that do not have listener.

method.name: prepend
method.description: Prepends a slot to this list.
method.param: slot The item to be prepended.
method.return: A list consisting of slot followed by all elements of this list.

method.name: length
method.description: The number of slots in the list.

field.name: NIL
field.description: Represents an empty list. Used as the list terminator.

method.name: addOnce
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: dispatch
method.description: Dispatches an object to listeners.
method.param: valueObjects Any number of parameters to send to listeners. Will be type-checked against valueClasses.
method.throws: ArgumentError ArgumentError: valueObjects are not compatible with valueClasses.

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Unsubscribes all listeners from the signal.

method.name: remove
method.description: Unsubscribes a listener from the signal.
method.param: listener
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: numListeners
method.description: The current number of listeners for the signal.

method.name: valueClasses
method.description: An optional array of classes defining the types of parameters sent to listeners.

interfaceRec.name: ISlot
interfaceRec.description:
The ISlot interface defines the basic properties of a
listener associated with a Signal.
interfaceRec.author: Joa Ebert
Robert Penner

method.name: execute0
method.description: Executes a listener without arguments. Existing params are appended before the listener is called.

method.name: execute1
method.description: Dispatches one argument to a listener. Existing params are appended before the listener is called.
method.param: value The argument for the listener.

method.name: execute
method.description: Executes a listener of arity n where n is valueObjects.length. Existing params are appended before the listener is called.
method.param: valueObjects The array of arguments to be applied to the listener.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes the slot from its signal.

method.name: enabled
method.description: Whether the listener is called on execution. Defaults to true.

method.name: listener
method.description: The listener associated with this slot.

method.name: once
method.description: Whether this slot is automatically removed after it has been used once.

method.name: params
priority
method.description:
The priority of this slot should be given in the execution order.
An IPrioritySignal will call higher numbers before lower ones.
Defaults to 0.

classRec.name: Slot
classRec.description: The Slot class represents a signal slot.
classRec.author: Robert Penner
Joa Ebert

method.name: Slot
method.description: Creates and returns a new Slot object.
method.param: listener The listener associated with the slot.
once Whether or not the listener should be executed only once.
signal The signal associated with the slot.
priority The priority of the slot.
method.throws: ArgumentError An error is thrown if the given listener closure is null.

method.name: execute0
method.description: Executes a listener without arguments. Existing params are appended before the listener is called.

method.name: execute1
method.description: Dispatches one argument to a listener. Existing params are appended before the listener is called.
method.param: value The argument for the listener.

method.name: execute
method.description: Executes a listener of arity n where n is valueObjects.length. Existing params are appended before the listener is called.
method.param: valueObjects The array of arguments to be applied to the listener.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes the slot from its signal.

method.name: toString
method.description: Creates and returns the string representation of the current object.
method.return: The string representation of the current object.

method.name: enabled
method.description: Whether the listener is called on execution. Defaults to true.

method.name: listener
method.description: The listener associated with this slot.

method.name: once
method.description: Whether this slot is automatically removed after it has been used once.

method.name: params
priority
method.description:
The priority of this slot should be given in the execution order.
An IPrioritySignal will call higher numbers before lower ones.
Defaults to 0.

method.name: add
method.description: Subscribes a listener for the signal.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

classRec.name: OnceSignal
classRec.description:
Signal dispatches events to multiple listeners. It is inspired by C# events and delegates, and by signals and slots in Qt. A Signal adds event dispatching functionality through composition and interfaces, rather than inheriting from a dispatcher.

Project home: http://github.com/robertpenner/as3-signals/

method.name: OnceSignal
method.description: Creates a Signal instance to dispatch value objects.
method.param:
valueClasses Any number of class references that enable type checks in dispatch().
For example, new Signal(String, uint)
would allow: signal.dispatch("the Answer", 42)
but not: signal.dispatch(true, 42.5)
nor: signal.dispatch()
NOTE: In AS3, subclasses cannot call super.apply(null, valueClasses),
but this constructor has logic to support super(valueClasses).

method.name: addOnce
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: dispatch
method.description: Dispatches an object to listeners.
method.param: valueObjects Any number of parameters to send to listeners. Will be type-checked against valueClasses.

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Unsubscribes all listeners from the signal.

method.name: remove
method.description: Unsubscribes a listener from the signal.
method.param: listener
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: numListeners
method.description: The current number of listeners for the signal.

method.name: valueClasses
method.description: An optional array of classes defining the types of parameters sent to listeners.

method.name: addOnceWithPriority
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with an argument
that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.

priority The priority level of the event listener.
The priority is designated by a signed 32-bit integer.
The higher the number, the higher the priority.
All listeners with priority n are processed before listeners of priority n-1.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: addWithPriority
method.description:
Subscribes a listener for the signal.
After you successfully register an event listener,
you cannot change its priority through additional calls to add().
To change a listener's priority, you must first call remove().
Then you can register the listener again with the new priority level.
method.param:
listener A function with an argument
that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

classRec.name: MonoSignal
classRec.description: A MonoSignal can have only one listener.

method.name: MonoSignal
method.description: Creates a MonoSignal instance to dispatch value objects.
method.param:
valueClasses Any number of class references that enable type checks in dispatch().
For example, new Signal(String, uint)
would allow: signal.dispatch("the Answer", 42)
but not: signal.dispatch(true, 42.5)
nor: signal.dispatch()
NOTE: Subclasses cannot call super.apply(null, valueClasses),
but this constructor has logic to support super(valueClasses).

method.name: addOnce
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.description: Subscribes a listener for the signal.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.description: Dispatches an object to listeners.
method.param: valueObjects Any number of parameters to send to listeners. Will be type-checked against valueClasses.

method.description: Unsubscribes a listener from the signal.

classRec.name: Signal
classRec.description:
Signal dispatches events to multiple listeners. It is inspired by C# events and delegates, and by signals and slots in Qt. A Signal adds event dispatching functionality through composition and interfaces, rather than inheriting from a dispatcher.

Project home: http://github.com/robertpenner/as3-signals/

method.description: Creates a Signal instance to dispatch value objects.
method.param:
valueClasses Any number of class references that enable type checks in dispatch().
For example, new Signal(String, uint)
would allow: signal.dispatch("the Answer", 42)
but not: signal.dispatch(true, 42.5)
nor: signal.dispatch()
NOTE: In AS3, subclasses cannot call super.apply(null, valueClasses),
but this constructor has logic to support super(valueClasses).

method.description: Subscribes a listener for the signal.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.

after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.

that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.

priority The priority level of the event listener.
The priority is designated by a signed 32-bit integer.
The higher the number, the higher the priority.

After you successfully register an event listener,

classRec.name: DeluxeSignal
classRec.description:
Signal dispatches events to multiple listeners. It is inspired by C# events and delegates, and by signals and slots in Qt. A Signal adds event dispatching functionality through composition and interfaces, rather than inheriting from a dispatcher.

Project home: http://github.com/robertpenner/as3-signals/

method.name: DeluxeSignal
method.description: Creates a DeluxeSignal instance to dispatch events on behalf of a target object.
method.param: target The object the signal is dispatching events on behalf of.

valueClasses Any number of class references that enable type checks in dispatch().
For example, new DeluxeSignal(this, String, uint)
would allow: signal.dispatch("the Answer", 42)
but not: signal.dispatch(true, 42.5)
nor: signal.dispatch()
NOTE: Subclasses cannot call super.apply(null, valueClasses),
but this constructor has logic to support super(valueClasses).

method.name: dispatch
method.description: Dispatches an object to listeners.
method.param: valueObjects Any number of parameters to send to listeners. Will be type-checked against valueClasses.

method.name: clone
method.description: Returns a new copy of the instance.

method.name: bubbles
method.description: Indicates whether the event is a bubbling event.

method.name: currentTarget
method.description: The object that added the listener for the event.

method.name: signal
method.description: The signal that dispatched the event.

method.name: target
method.description:
The object that originally dispatched the event.
When dispatched from an signal, the target is the object containing the signal.

method.name: onEventBubbled
method.description:
Handler for event bubbling.
It's left to the IBubbleEventHandler to decide what to do with the event.
method.param: event The event that bubbled up.
method.return: whether to continue bubbling this event

classRec.name: GenericEvent
classRec.see:
org.osflash.signals.events.IEvent
Documentation for the event interface being maintained in IEvent to avoid duplication for now.

method.name: clone
method.description: Returns a new copy of the instance.

method.name: bubbles
method.description: Indicates whether the event is a bubbling event.

method.name: currentTarget
method.description: The object that added the listener for the event.

method.name: signal
method.description: The signal that dispatched the event.

method.name: target
method.description:
The object that originally dispatched the event.
When dispatched from an signal, the target is the object containing the signal.

classRec.name: NativeSignalSet
classRec.description: A convenient way to access a logical set of signals.
classRec.author: Jon Adams

method.name: getNativeSignal
method.description: Lazily instantiates a NativeSignal

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Unsubscribes all listeners from all signals in the set.

method.name: numListeners
method.description: The current number of listeners for the signal.

method.name: signals
method.description: The signals in the SignalSet as an Array.

interfaceRec.name: INativeDispatcher
interfaceRec.description: Similar to IDispatcher but using strong types specific to Flash's native event system.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.description: Dispatches an event to listeners.
method.param: event An instance of a class that is or extends flash.events.Event.
method.throws: ArgumentError ArgumentError: Event object [event] is not an instance of [eventClass].
ArgumentError ArgumentError: Event object has incorrect type. Expected [eventType] but was [event.type].

method.name: eventClass
method.description: The class of event permitted to be dispatched. Will be flash.events.Event or a subclass.

method.name: eventType
method.description: The type of event permitted to be dispatched. Corresponds to flash.events.Event.type.

method.name: target
method.description: The object considered the source of the dispatched events.

classRec.name: NativeRelaySignal
classRec.description:
The NativeRelaySignal class is used to relay events from an IEventDispatcher
to listeners.
The difference as compared to NativeSignal is that
NativeRelaySignal has its own dispatching code,
whereas NativeSignal uses the IEventDispatcher to dispatch.

method.name: NativeRelaySignal
method.description: Creates a new NativeRelaySignal instance to relay events from an IEventDispatcher.
method.param: target An object that implements the flash.events.IEventDispatcher interface.
eventType The event string name that would normally be passed to IEventDispatcher.addEventListener().

eventClass An optional class reference that enables an event type check in dispatch().
Because the target is an IEventDispatcher,
eventClass needs to be flash.events.Event or a subclass of it.

method.name: addOnceWithPriority
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with an argument
that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.

priority The priority level of the event listener.
The priority is designated by a signed 32-bit integer.
The higher the number, the higher the priority.
All listeners with priority n are processed before listeners of priority n-1.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: addWithPriority
method.description:
Subscribes a listener for the signal.
After you successfully register an event listener,
you cannot change its priority through additional calls to add().
To change a listener's priority, you must first call remove().
Then you can register the listener again with the new priority level.
method.param:
listener A function with an argument
that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.description:
Unlike other signals, NativeRelaySignal does not dispatch null
because it causes an exception in EventDispatcher.
Dispatches an event to listeners.
method.param: event An instance of a class that is or extends flash.events.Event.

method.name: dispatch
method.description: Dispatches an object to listeners.
method.param: valueObjects Any number of parameters to send to listeners. Will be type-checked against valueClasses.

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Unsubscribes all listeners from the signal.

method.name: remove
method.description: Unsubscribes a listener from the signal.
method.param: listener
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: eventClass
method.description: The class of event permitted to be dispatched. Will be flash.events.Event or a subclass.

method.name: eventType
method.description: The type of event permitted to be dispatched. Corresponds to flash.events.Event.type.

method.name: target
method.description: The object considered the source of the dispatched events.

classRec.name: NativeSignal
classRec.description:
The NativeSignal class provides a strongly-typed facade for an IEventDispatcher.
A NativeSignal is essentially a mini-dispatcher locked to a specific event type and class.
It can become part of an interface.

method.name: NativeSignal
method.description: Creates a NativeSignal instance to dispatch events on behalf of a target object.
method.param: target The object on whose behalf the signal is dispatching events.
eventType The type of Event permitted to be dispatched from this signal. Corresponds to Event.type.
eventClass An optional class reference that enables an event type check in dispatch(). Defaults to flash.events.Event if omitted.

method.name: addOnceWithPriority
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with an argument
that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.

priority The priority level of the event listener.
The priority is designated by a signed 32-bit integer.
The higher the number, the higher the priority.
All listeners with priority n are processed before listeners of priority n-1.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: addOnce
method.description:
Subscribes a one-time listener for this signal.
The signal will remove the listener automatically the first time it is called,
after the dispatch to all listeners is complete.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: addWithPriority
method.description:
Subscribes a listener for the signal.
After you successfully register an event listener,
you cannot change its priority through additional calls to add().
To change a listener's priority, you must first call remove().
Then you can register the listener again with the new priority level.
method.param:
listener A function with an argument
that matches the type of event dispatched by the signal.
If eventClass is not specified, the listener and dispatch() can be called without an argument.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: add
method.description: Subscribes a listener for the signal.
method.param:
listener A function with arguments
that matches the value classes dispatched by the signal.
If value classes are not specified (e.g. via Signal constructor), dispatch() can be called without arguments.
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.description:
Unlike other signals, NativeSignal does not dispatch null
because it causes an exception in EventDispatcher.
Dispatches an event to listeners.
method.param: event An instance of a class that is or extends flash.events.Event.

method.name: dispatch
method.description: Dispatches an object to listeners.
method.param: valueObjects Any number of parameters to send to listeners. Will be type-checked against valueClasses.

method.name: removeAll
method.description: Unsubscribes all listeners from the signal.

method.name: remove
method.description: Unsubscribes a listener from the signal.
method.param: listener
method.return: a ISlot, which contains the Function passed as the parameter

method.name: eventClass
method.description: The class of event permitted to be dispatched. Will be flash.events.Event or a subclass.

method.name: eventType
method.description: The type of event permitted to be dispatched. Corresponds to flash.events.Event.type.

method.name: numListeners
method.description: The current number of listeners for the signal.

method.name: target
method.description: The object considered the source of the dispatched events.

method.name: valueClasses
method.description: An optional array of classes defining the types of parameters sent to listeners.

classRec.name: NativeMappedSignal
classRec.description:
The NativeMappedSignal class is used to map/transform a native Event, relayed from an IEventDispatcher, into other forms of data, which are dispatched to all listeners.

This can be used to form a border where native flash Events do not cross.

method.name: NativeMappedSignal
method.description:
Creates a new NativeMappedSignal instance to map/transform a native Event,
relayed from an IEventDispatcher, into other forms of data,
which are dispatched to all listeners.
method.param: target An object that implements the flash.events.IEventDispatcher interface.
eventType The event string name that would normally be passed to IEventDispatcher.addEventListener().
eventClass An optional class reference that enables an event type check in dispatch().
mappedTypes an optional list of types that enables the checking of the types mapped from an Event.

method.name: mapEvent
method.description: For usage without extension, instances of NativeMappedSignal that are dispatching any values ( valueClasses.length > 0 ), needs to be provided with a either a mapping function or a list of object literals. See mapTo for more info. Subclasses could override this one instead of letting the environment set the mapTo, MAKE SURE to also override mapTo(...) if it should not be allowed.
method.return: An object or Array of objects mapped from an Event. The mapping of Event to data will be performed by the mapping function if it is set. A list of object literals can also be supplied in place of the mapping function. If no mapping function or object literals are supplied then an empty Array is returned or if valueClasses.length > 0 an ArgumentError is thrown.
method.parameter: eventFromTarget the event that was dispatched from target.

method.name: mapTo
method.description:
Sets the mapping function or literal object list.
If the argument is a list of object literals then this list is dispatched to listeners.
<listing version="3.0">
signal = new NativeMappedSignal(button, MouseEvent.CLICK, MouseEvent, String).mapTo("ping")
signal.add(function(arg:String):void { trace(arg) }) // prints "ping"
</listing>
And an example passing a list of literals:
<listing version="3.0">
signal = new NativeMappedSignal(button, MouseEvent.CLICK, MouseEvent, String, int, Number).mapTo("ping", 3, 3.1415)
signal.add(function(arg1:String, arg2:int, arg3:Number):void { trace(arg1, arg2, arg3) }) // prints "ping", 3, 3.1415
</listing>
If the argument is a function then it is called when the event this NativeMappedSignal is listening for is dispatched.
The function should return an Array or a single object. The data returned from the function is passed along as arguments in the Signal dispatch.
Lets look at some examples of mapping functions and the function that is called back:
<listing version="3.0">
signal = new NativeMappedSignal(button, MouseEvent.CLICK, MouseEvent, String).mapTo(function():void {
return "ping"
})
signal.add(function(arg:String):void { trace(arg) }) // prints "ping"
</listing>
and here's an example using a list of arguments:
<listing version="3.0">
signal = new NativeMappedSignal(button, MouseEvent.CLICK, MouseEvent, String, int, Number).mapTo(function():void {
return ["ping", 3, 3.1415]
})
signal.add(function(arg1:String, arg2:int, arg3:Number):void { trace(arg1, arg2, arg3) }) // prints "ping", 3, 3.1415
</listing>
You can also state your wish to receive the native Event in th mapping function by simply including an argument of type Event:
<listing version="3.0">
signal = new NativeMappedSignal(button, MouseEvent.CLICK, MouseEvent, Point).mapTo(function(event:MouseEvent):void {
return new Point(event.localX, event.localY)
})
signal.add(function(arg:Point):void { trace(arg) }) // prints "(x=128, y=256)"
</listing>
method.param: objectListOrFunction This can either be a list of object literals or a function that returns list of objects.
method.return: The NativeMappedSignal object this method was called on. This allows the Signal to be defined and mapped in one statement.

method.name: eventClass
method.description: The class of event permitted to be dispatched. Will be flash.events.Event or a subclass.

field.name: _mappingFunction
field.default: is null, no mapping will occur
